data.title: ‘Thrilling end’: AFL sets last day blockbusters
data.meta_description: The AFL top eight could be decided in the final match of the season after the league confirmed what the last round would look like.
data.text:
Five of the six teams playing on the final day of the AFL season could be jockeying for positions in the top eight after the league locked in a blockbuster end to the regular season.

The Western Bulldogs, currently seventh, host Greater Western Sydney, who are fourth, to launch the day at Mars Stadium in Ballarat.

Eighth-placed Carlton, just hanging on to their spot, will then host St Kilda at Marvel Stadium in a game that could determine their fate, with the potential for the Blues to drop out of the eight this weekend before the final two rounds.

Fremantle (sixth) and Port Adelaide (third) will know every scenario when they meet in the last game of the round at Optus Stadium to close out the season.

Hawthorn’s finals chances could come down to its clash against North Melbourne in Hobart at 4.35pm before Brisbane meets Essendon at the Gabba under lights in another match with important September implications.

Melbourne and Collingwood will kick off the round when they meet at the MCG on Friday night.

This season has been one of the tightest in memory with just 10 premiership points separating the Sydney Swans in top spot and ninth-placed Essendon.

The AFL has used the opportunity to close the season with a bang to keep supporters invested until the final siren of the round.

“One of the most competitive seasons in our game’s history is coming to a thrilling end, with the round-24 fixture delivering an appropriate crescendo to our home-and-away season,” AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon said.

Round-24 fixture

Friday August 23

Melbourne v Collingwood, 7.40pm MCG

Saturday August 24

Geelong v West Coast, 1.45pm GMHBA Stadium

Hawthorn v North Melbourne, 4.35pm, Launceston

Richmond v Gold Coast, 2.10pm, MCG

Brisbane Lions v Essendon, 7.25pm, Gabba

Sydney v Adelaide, 7.40pm, SCG

Sunday August 25

Western Bulldogs v GWS, 2.30pm, Ballarat

Carlton v St Kilda, 3.20pm, Marvel Stadium

Fremantle v Port Adelaide, 6.10pm, Optus Stadium
